name: Hotel Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are not always sure about a hotel booking. The Paris Hotel in Prague is well priced for 5 Star, excellent located and a delightful place to stay with excellent service. I would highly recommend to anyone going to Prague
reviews.title: A very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: And in the current economy, a great bargain. Walking distance to many sights. Beautiful Art Nouveau (not Gothic!) building, decoration, and room furnishings. Right off náměstí Republiky and with a Metro station entrance right there, but the rooms are quiet because of double windows and double doors. Cleanest hotel I have been in, and joy! they provide washcloths! As an American I miss these in Europe. Such a comfortable bed- I loved it. Helpful attentive staff, and good breakfast was included with my reservation. Desk staff arranged a taxi to the airport for when I checked out - at a good price too. I would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Luxurious stay in a beautiful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a neo-gothic building conveniently located in city centre.
reviews.title: UNIQUE

reviews.text: Cheerful, lively atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great staff and great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff is friendly, helpful and likeable.
reviews.title: excellent, excellent, excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based upon a family member recomendation. I found a rate of 100 euro a night with advance pre payment on Priceline Europe, but later discovered $128 a night on hotels .com, it pays to shop the rate. Anyway we arrived at 6am in Prague, used Prague airport transfers to go from the airport to the hotel. Interestingly the cab charged $31 from the airport to hotel but tried to charge $37 on the return. Watch the drivers. At least they arrived on time!
reviews.title: Exceptional Paris

reviews.text: The concierge and all the staff were extremely helpfull, efficient and friendly. Katka was very helpfull.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel with wonderful staff
Perfect location
reviews.text: Breakfast was Ritz Carlton good, with eastern europe twist, carrot juice, pate, great eggs, fab bread , yougurt, hot and cold dishes, fish, meat, cheese, salad, fruit, only the best, fresh and well prepared.

The service at every level made you feel like you were visiting a wealthy uncle rather than a luxury boutique hotel. The one odd thing was the public computer in the lobby available to guests was a MAC and none of the staff or my self could use it. No bother the conceriege searched and printed out anything I needed. This hotlel is a gem next to Namesty Repubilca square and metro stop.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel offering great value

reviews.text: Around the corrner is the Municipal Theatre, Alberts Market, many Banks and a luxury mall.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was truly a great find! The horible treatment we got @ The Marriott reception led us to find this remarkable hotel. Take note Marriott: The Hotel Paris was on all levels Five Stars, the staff, food, security,rooms and style were all excellent! I must say when you find a Hotel like this it's easy to tell everyone you know what a remarkable place and time you had staying there. It really made our stay in Prague wonderful. I would highly suggest anyone who's use to staying @ large chain hotels skip them when visiting Prague and stay @ The Hotel Paris. I've stayed @ Ritz Carltons,Mandrian Orentials,Omni's, W Hotels, Marriott's etc. and have never had the treatment or shown such class that I did @ The Hotel Paris.
reviews.title: Five Stars!

reviews.text: Bravo Hotel Paris!
reviews.title: A unique and comfortable establishment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is quite a unique establishment. It is beautifully decorated in Art Nouveau decor, and has lovely works of art in its lobby and its corridors. The hotel's location is perfect, as it is in the center of Prague. Indeed, there is a Prague Metro station in front of the establishment! Nevertheless, I had no trouble sleeping, as it was quiet overnight. I found my room very comfortable, and the reception staff very helpful.
reviews.title: enhanced our enjoyment of prague.

reviews.text: One other thing I appreciated about this hotel was that they provided me a chauffeured drive to the Prague Airport when I left the city. I greatly appreciated this, as Prague's cabbies are notorious for ripping off customers.
reviews.title: good service and nice rooms

reviews.text: Overall, I highly recommend the Hotel Paris to anyone. It is a unique and comfortable establishment!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The portier was exceptional in his service. His attentiveness and friendly personality is truly commendable. We parked in front of the hotel and he was there to assist us before we were even out of the automobile. He was the first impression we had of the hotel and immediately made us feel welcome then and when our paths crossed throughout
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

reviews.text: the stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast personnel also to be complimented for friendliness and attentive service.
reviews.title: For a luxury indulgence Hotel Paris is hard to beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location but has very limited parking , be sure to reserve parking if possible.
reviews.title: Great staff, lovely accommodations

reviews.text: We ( two couples) just returned from a three week trip. One of the highlights was the time we spent in Prague and at the Hotel Paris. The hotel is lovely. We enjoyed the wonderful art deco/noveau interiors. My husband and I had previously stayed there in 1994 when it was called the Hotel Pariz. We had fond memories of the hotel and its art deco interior. We booked hoping our return visit would be as great as the previous one. We were not disappointed. The hotel since our last visit has been updated and it is a art deco gem with great services. Wonderful breakfasts. Interesting bar area ! Good services in the European tradition.
reviews.title: Good choice

description: Hotel Paris offers luxury hotel rooms and suites in Prague with an exclusive view of Prague Old Town, furthermore a French and traditional Czech hotel restaurant in Prague, Parisian style Café de Paris. Hotel Paris also includes a relaxation centre Wellness & Spa in the heart of Prague city centre, where you can perhaps try a Thai massage.
